definitions.definition: ( chiefly UK , Ireland ) The landlord ( manager or owner ) of a public house ( “ a bar or tavern , often also selling food and sometimes lodging ; a pub ” ) .
( Commonwealth , by extension ) The manager or owner of a hotel .

main_definition: ( chiefly UK , Ireland ) The landlord ( manager or owner ) of a public house ( “ a bar or tavern , often also selling food and sometimes lodging ; a pub ” ) .
secondary_definitions: ( Commonwealth , by extension ) The manager or owner of a hotel .

definitions.definition: A tax collector , especially one working in Judea and Galilee during New Testament times (1st century C.E. ) who was generally regarded as sinful for extorting more tax than was due , and as a traitor for serving the Roman Empire .
Any person who collects customs duties , taxes, tolls , or other forms of public revenue .

subdefinitions.definition: One regarded as extorting money from others by charging high prices .
A person excommunicated from the church ; an excommunicant or excommunicate ; also, a person who does not follow a Christian religion ; a heathen , a pagan .

main_definition: ( Ancient Rome , historical ) A tax collector , especially one working in Judea and Galilee during New Testament times (1st century C.E. ) who was generally regarded as sinful for extorting more tax than was due , and as a traitor for serving the Roman Empire .
secondary_definitions: ( by extension , archaic ) Any person who collects customs duties , taxes, tolls , or other forms of public revenue .
